name: spatiotemporally
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that relates to both space and time, or to space-time (= the part of Einstein's Theory of Relativity that adds the idea of time to those of height, depth, and length): Climate provides a framework within which malaria transmission is possible, but other factors may influence transmission spatiotemporally. These studies estimate distributions over spatio-temporally defined areas.
More examplesFewer examplesThese molecules are spatiotemporally distributed in the developing embryo.Geology is closely linked to the course of events in a spatiotemporally restricted part of the universe.He argues that there may be many possible worlds spatio-temporally distinct from ours.
